greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime divisors of 55...1 (with n 5s).
comment: Number of distinct prime factors of (10^(n + 1) - 1)*5/9 - 4. - _Stefan Steinerberger_, Mar 06 2006
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
example: The number of distinct prime divisors of 51 is 2 which is the first term in the sequence.
The number of distinct prime divisors of 551 is 2 which is the second term in the sequence.
The number of distinct prime divisors of 5551 is 3 which is the third term in the sequence.
results.author: _Parthasarathy Nambi_, Apr 19 2005
ext: a(51)-a(92), and offset corrected, by _Robert Israel_, Mar 08 2018
